main_definition: An obligation refers to a duty or commitment that one is morally, legally, or socially bound to fulfill.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A legal obligation arising from law
meanings_and_examples.example: John was under the obligation to pay taxes on his income as per the government regulations.
Helping an elderly person cross the street is considered a moral obligation for many people.
As a daughter, Jane feels obliged to take care of her aging parents.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An agreement between parties that creates an obligation to do something
meanings_and_examples.example: The contractual obligation requires the company to deliver products by the agreed-upon date.
